div.head: Encoding Guide for the COREL project
About the COREL project
div.p: The COREL project is a project between the Collège de France and EFEO. It is financed by CollEx Persée and based on earlier research projects (Legalizing Space in China, Emerging Procedural Justice). Its goal is to recreate the legislation of Imperial China under the Qing Dynasty and to preserve a unique collection of documents about legal, administrative and social history of modern China.

div.head: About this document
div.p: This document is an encoding guide to explain the choices and specificites of this edition. It gives details about how we used the TEI to encode our corpus and focuses on the TEI elements that we use in our edition. It is also meant to ensure consistency in the encoding of our documents.

div.head: Encoding Guide
div.p: Legal codes are documents with a defined and regular structure, which is why encoding such documents requires precise encoding rules to follow. This guide will present our encoding choices.

titleStmt is a mandatory element. We use the chinese title transcribed with roman characters, followed by the title in chinese characters and the date of the code in parenthesis.

div.p: editionStmt offers information about the online edition of the code. It contains the following elements :

edition is an element that contains a brief description of the purpose of the online edition. It is the same for all the legal codes, as they were all encoded in XML-TEI specifically for this project. This description will differ for other documents that are not part of our corpus, but are meant to be encoded and published on our website in the future.

egXML.edition: This edition was encoded for the COREL project, in order to publish a corpus of documents on legal history of Imperial China.

sourceDesc.p: The XML documents we transformed into XML-TEI were originally edited and published by the LSC project. The editions are available online on their website as a trilingual edition of the codes. Da Qing lüli- version du Duli cunyi 大清律例-讀例存疑 (1906), originally published in 1906

div.p: Additional information about the original sources can be also be contained by the element sourceDesc.
The profileDesc is an important element for this project because entities (places and people) are linked to the evolution of the legal codes.The profileDesc contains two elements :

The particDesc element contains the list of persName present in the code. Each person is attributed a mandatory xml:id and a mandatory role. Inside the person element, the persName element must contain the ref attribute. Biographic notes about the person can be included if necessary.
The settingDesc element contains the list of placeName present in the code. Each place is attributed a mandatory xml:id. Notes about the place can be included if necessary.
The encodingDesc element provides a description of the encoding project.
The text element contains :

The front element only contains introductory charts for the legal code of 1740. There are no other introductory elements in the other documents that we wanted to keep. These synoptic charts are interesting to keep in order to hava a global view of the different themes present in the codes.
There are always seven chapters in legal codes, so the body element only contains seven div element.

div.head: Chapters (bu)
div.p: The body element must only contain nested div.The divisions directly contained in the body have a mandatory type attribute and its value is always chapter. The n attribute is also mandatory and numbers the seven chapters. Chapters always start by a title. Chapters, as well as sections, statutes and substatutes, should contain a pb element and a facs attribute to link images to our encoding.

div.head: Sections (men)
div.p: Chapters must also contain nested div. The div elements contained in a chapter are necessarily sections, so they have a mandatory type attribute and its value is always section. Sections are structured just like chapters : they are numbered and have a title, as well as a pb element with a facs attribute.

div.head: Mingli lü shang 名例律上名者，五刑之罪名。例者，五刑之體例也。
Statutes (lü)
div.p: Statutes are contained by sections. They are also marked by the div element, with a mandatory type attribute. Its value is always statute. Statutes are also numbered but starting from 0. They start by a head element, followed by one or several paragraphs. They have a mandatory xml:id

To recreate the legislation of imperial China, we need information on the year the law was applied and the year it ended. We chose to extend the TEI in order to add the following attributes : notBefore and notAfter on statutes and substatutes.

div.head: Moufan dani 謀反大逆
div.p: 凡謀反 不利於國，謂謀危社稷 及大逆 不利於君，謂謀毀宗廟、山陵及宮闕， 但共謀者，不分首從 已未行，皆凌遲處死。 正犯之 祖父、父、子孫、兄弟及同居之人 如本族無服親屬及外祖父、妻父、女壻之類，不分異姓及 正犯之期親 伯叔父、兄弟之子，不限 已未析居 籍之同異， 男 年十六以上，不論篤疾、廢疾，皆斬。其 男 十五以下，及 正犯之 母、女、妻妾、姊妹、若子之妻妾，給付功臣之家為奴。 正犯 財産入官。若女 兼姊妹 許嫁已定，歸其夫。 正犯 子孫過房與人，及 正犯之 聘妻未成者，俱不追坐。 上止坐正犯兄弟之子，不及其孫。餘律文不載， 并不得株連。 知情故縱隱藏者，斬。有能捕獲 正犯 者，民授以民官，軍授以軍職 量功授職, 仍將犯人財産全給充賞。知而首告，官為捕獲者，止給財産。 雖無故縱，但 不首者，杖一百、流三千里。 未行，而親屬告捕到官，正犯與緣坐人俱同自首，免。已行，惟正犯不免，餘免。非親屬首捕，雖未行， 仍依律坐。

div.head: Substatutes (tiaoli)
div.p: Substatutes are structured like statutes. They are represented by the div element and have a type attribute, with the substatute value. Each statute contains one or several substatutes which are numbered. Just like statutes, they have mandatory notBefore, notAfter and xml:id attributes . They should also contain the pb element with a facs attribute.

一、反逆案内律應問擬凌遲之犯，其子孫訊明，實係不知謀逆情事者，無論已未成丁，均解交内務府閹割， 發往新疆等處，給官兵為奴。如年在十歲以下者，牢固監禁，俟年届十一歲時，再行解交内務府，照例辦理。 内務府大臣遇有解到閹割人犯，即遴派司員認眞看驗，並出具無弊切結，送交刑部，再行覆驗。如有情弊，即行奏參， 務須查驗明確，再交兵部，發往新疆，給官兵為奴。至其餘律應緣坐男犯，並非逆犯子孫，年在十六歲以上者，發往新疆等處， 給官兵為奴。如年在十五歲以下者，牢固監禁，俟成丁時再行發遣。緣坐婦女，發各省駐防，給官員兵丁為奴。其知情不首干連人犯，仍依律擬流。

div.head: Commentaries
div.p: Commentaries are contained inside the note element. The official commentaries, included into the legal code, are contained inside paragraphs. They have a mandatory type attribute and its value is official.

There are other types of commentaries. These are placed after the statute or the substatute. They have a mandatory type attribute to distinguish them from the official commentaries. Some commentaries contain additionnal metadata about the origin of a law. They are marked with the metadata type.
The element persName has a ref attribute which calls the xml:id related to the person in the particDesc. The role attribute is mandatory and its value can be : governor, party
We chose not to distinguish forenames and surnames in our encoding, because it is not relevant for chinese entities. The persName element only distinguishes names and role names.

The element placeName is similar to the persName element in its structure. It has a type attribute to identify whether the place is where the law is applied, or where the law comes from.. The attribute is mandatory and its value can be : origin or application It also has a ref attribute to identify which place it is thanks to the xml:id in the settingDesc.
The bibl element is used for bibliographic references present inside the legal code.

div.head: Lists
div.p: In the Huidian Shili, some lists appear after the substatutes. These sections give details about judicial procedures and criminal matters. Each list element is composed of several item elements. These items must contain two elements : a date and one or several p.

item.p: 諭。各衙門應責人犯。悉遵用鞭責。不許用杖。又奏准。五刑中死罪居二。曰斬曰絞。明律分別差等。絞斬互用。我朝法制。罪應死者止用斬刑。嗣後麗重典者仍分斬絞。按律引擬。至以板易鞭。尤當酌得其中。定以三鞭准一板。
除割腳筋法。又舊例犯重辟減等者。鞭一百。貫耳鼻。奉旨。耳鼻在人身最為顯著。此刑永革除之。
